page.title: 06PICTISH CAIRNS-BROADFORD
page.content: {The Cairn}at Waterloo was probably built by the{Picts}and was there before Jesus.The proper name for Waterloo was{Achadh Chairn}"Cairn Field".It became Waterloo after the Napoleonic battle at Waterloo.The Liveras Cairn has been excavated and items have been taken to the Edinburgh Museum.The cairn on MacHattie's{croft has been opened and a spearhead found. A professor has said that it will be excavated within the next 30 years.All the local cairns are more or less in line with each other.In Rudh an Dunan the cairns have been opened and pottery and iron weapons were found. Waterloo is a very fine example of a{Pictish Cairn.}The entrance is on the N.E.side of the cairn with flat stones about 13ft long & 9in thick on top of the tomb.
